snippet: The number of people who enrolled in programs to expedite passage through security checkpoints rose, John Pistole says, as did the number of guns found during screenings.
abstract: Joe Sharkey On the Road column features conversation with outgoing Transportation Security Administration head John S Pistole, who says over 45 percent of airline passengers have enrolled in programs to move quickly through airport security checkpoints; Pistole says rules restricting carrying liquids through security will eventually be eased.
lead_paragraph: The number of people who enrolled in programs to expedite passage through security checkpoints rose, John Pistole says, as did the number of guns found during screenings.

headline.print_headline: Considering the Year in Airport Security, With the T.S.A. Chief
headline.main: Considering the Year in Airport Security, With the T.S.A. Chief
